APPLICANT NAME: MERCERSBURG WATER AUTHORITY - WATER SYSTEM IMPROVEMENTS, PHASE 1
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Construction of Park Avenue treatment facility for new well, including softening, nitrate removal, and systems for chlorination; includes a 300,000-gal storage tank and 500-gpm booster pump station.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Existing Buck Run filter plant has numerous Safe Drinking Water Act violations; Authority entered COA to develop groundwater source and new treatment facilities to abandon existing plant.

APPLICANT NAME: CITY OF PHILADELPHIA- EAST PARK BOOSTER PUMPING STATION
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Construction of a new booster pump station with four 24 MGD pumps to improve emergency resiliency and replace an aging 1937 station.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Existing station is critical for moving water across the Schuylkill River and acts as the sole emergency backup for the Belmont Water Treatment Plant.

APPLICANT NAME: BOROUGH OF BRACKENRIDGE - WATER FILTRATION PLANT CONSENT ORDER IMPROVEMENTS
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Upgrades to water treatment plant to remedy structural and operational deficiencies, including new site piping, flocculation tank, clarifier equipment, and demolition of circular clarifier.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: The Borough entered a COA on June 27, 2024, to improve the plant, specifically addressing automatic shutdown capability for the Clearwell and structural repairs to the clarifier.

APPLICANT NAME: SCHUYLKILL COUNTY MUNICIPAL AUTHORITY MOREA SYSTEM IMPROVEMENTS
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: New treatment facility for iron/manganese removal, new submersible well pump, booster pumps, 830 feet of transmission main, and replacement of 120 service lines and meters.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Catastrophic storage tank failure in 2022 left the Morea Citizens Water Company with no storage; SCMA has taken over to restore source reliability and emergency fire service.

APPLICANT NAME: CLEARFIELD MUNICIPAL AUTHORITY - MONTGOMERY RUN WATER TREATMENT FACILITY UPGRADES
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: New treatment building housing a membrane filtration system, below-grade baffled concrete Clearwell, and replacement of process equipment, high service pumps, and SCADA.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Facility built in 1990 is under CO&A; specific equipment no longer meets regulations or reliably produces drinking water; project is step one for reservoir rehabilitation.

APPLICANT NAME: 2025 NORTHAMPTON BUCKS COUNTY MUNICIPAL AUTHORITY CHURCHVILLE PUBLIC WATER PROJECT
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Extension of public water system to residences in Churchville Manor and Hillside Manor subdivisions, including water mains, 334 connections, and treatment upgrades to public wells.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: PFAS contamination (PFOS/PFOA) resulting from former Naval Air Warfare Center activities; treatment is required to meet new EPA MCLs and address residents' contamination concerns.

APPLICANT NAME: PITTSBURGH WSA - 2023 SMALL DIAMETER WATER MAIN REPLACEMENT (NON-LEAD)
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of approximately 52,880 feet of aging and undersized 8-inch and 12-inch water mains with new zinc-coated ductile iron pipe.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Advanced age of pipes causes frequent breaks, risking public health through potential infectious disease exposure and causing unplanned water outages.

APPLICANT NAME: AQUA PENNSYLVANIA WATER MAIN REPLACEMENTS (2024-2027) (PROFI)
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: 21 water main replacement projects across 14 municipalities and 4 counties in SE PA, totaling nearly 133,400 linear feet of 8 to 20-inch pipe.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Capital improvements to replace mains at the end of their useful life with histories of leaks or poor condition.

APPLICANT NAME: MUNICIPAL AUTHORITY OF THE CITY OF NEW KENSINGTON 2024 WATERLINE REPLACEMENTS/WTP FILTER MEDIA REPLACEMENT
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of 5,600 linear feet of waterlines and appurtenances; project also includes new media for the treatment plant to restore filter efficiency.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Old, deteriorated waterlines are causing numerous breaks, service shutdowns, and water loss; existing filter media has degraded, reducing treatment output.

APPLICANT NAME: AQUA PENNSYLVANIA INC. - HIGHLAND GLEN WELL PFAS PROJECT PWSID 1460073
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of well pump and installation of anion exchange treatment vessels with pre-filtration in a heated enclosure to treat PFOA and PFOS.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Monitoring has detected PFOA and PFOS in water collected at entry points in the Aqua PA Main system.

APPLICANT NAME: COMBINED HAZLETON CITY AUTHORITY VILLAGE OF BUCK MTN WATER MAIN REPLACEMENT - W
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of a pressure regulating station, 6,500 feet of 8-inch pipe, and upgrading/expanding the Dreck Creek Pump Station from 4.75 to 10.47 MGD.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Undertaken due to large numbers of pipe failures in older cast iron lines and to meet increasing system demand.

APPLICANT NAME: BRADFORD CITY WATER AUTHORITY - SYSTEM-WIDE METER REPLACEMENTS
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of 5,797 existing water meters with new meters and an Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI) system.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Existing meters are approximately 25 years old; many are failing or under-registering, resulting in high labor costs for re-reading 4,800 meters annually.

APPLICANT NAME: AQUA PENNSYLVANIA INC. - WILLOWDALE CROSSING WELL PFAS PROJECT PWSID 1150098
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of well pump and installation of granular activated carbon treatment vessels in a heated enclosure to address detections of PFOA.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Monitoring has detected PFOA and PFOS at entry points in the Aqua PA West Chester system.

APPLICANT NAME: AQUA PENNSYLVANIA INC. - APPLEWOOD WELL HOUSE PFAS PROJECT PWSID 2400083
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Installation of ion exchange units to adsorb PFOS and PFOA compounds from an existing well source.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Project aims to minimize PFOS (max 5.4 ppt) and PFOA (max 4.6 ppt) in finished water via treatment.

APPLICANT NAME: AQUA PENNSYLVANIA INC. - WHITE HAVEN TREATMENT WELL PFAS PROJECT PWSID 2400108
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Installation of ion exchange units to adsorb PFOS and PFOA compounds at the well source.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Detections of PFOS (max 7.0 ppt) and PFOA (max 4.0 ppt) in existing well water necessitate treatment.

APPLICANT NAME: AQUA PENNSYLVANIA INC. - FRANKLIN WELL PFAS PROJECT 1150126
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of well pump and installation of granular activated carbon treatment vessels in a heated enclosure.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Monitoring has indicated detections of PFOA and PFOS in entry points of the Aqua PA Franklin system.

APPLICANT NAME: AQUA PENNSYLVANIA INC. - FRIENDSHIP WELL PFAS PROJECT PWSID 1150137
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of two well pumps and installation of anion exchange treatment vessels with pre-filtration to treat PFOA and PFOS detections.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Analytical results show detections of PFOA and PFOS at entry points for the Friendship Wells 2 and 4.

APPLICANT NAME: AQUA PENNSYLVANIA INC. - PERKIOMEN PFAS PROJECT PWSID 1460069
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Installation of anion exchange (AIX) vessels with pre-filtration and replacement of well pump at the Cranberry 2 well.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: PFAS monitoring has detected PFOA and PFOS at the site; while not currently exceeding PA MCLs, treatment is proposed to minimize presence.

APPLICANT NAME: AQUA PENNSYLVANIA INC. - CHALFONT WELL 14 PFAS PROJECT PWSID 1090005
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of well pump and installation of anion exchange resin vessels for PFAS treatment with pre-filtration.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Monitoring has detected PFOA and PFOS at entry points in the Aqua PA Chalfont system.

APPLICANT NAME: HAZLETON CITY AUTHORITY MOUNT PLEASANT FINISHED WATER STORAGE TANK
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Construction of a new 3.0-million-gallon capacity finished water storage tank, valve house, controls, and SCADA communication.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: High system demand is straining the distribution system; the tank will create an operational buffer to handle demands without large fluctuations in pressure.

APPLICANT NAME: CITY OF PHILADELPHIA 2026 PART 2
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of approximately 950 residential private lead and galvanized steel service lines with new copper lines in the PWD service area.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Project eliminates lead from water supply, improving conditions for vulnerable populations and increasing public awareness of lead exposure risks.

APPLICANT NAME: CITY OF PHILADELPHIA 2026 PART 1
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of approximately 950 residential private lead and galvanized steel service lines with new copper lines.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Aimed at eliminating lead for renters and low-income populations, specifically those on fixed incomes or with elderly/child family members.

APPLICANT NAME: PENNSYLVANIA AMERICAN - MECHANICSBURG LSLR PHASE 3
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of 346 utility/private owned lead and galvanized water service lines using trenchless or trenched methods from house to water main.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Eliminates potential lead poisoning from services partially constructed of lead pipe, following guidance to remove lead throughout the system.

APPLICANT NAME: PENNSYLVANIA AMERICAN - MECHANICSBURG LSLR PHASE 2
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of 304 utility/private owned lead and galvanized service lines from house to water main.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Addresses health issues associated with lead-based service lines and eliminates risk of lead poisoning in the service area.

APPLICANT NAME: PENNSYLVANIA AMERICAN - COATSVILLE LSLR PHASE 1
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of 240 utility/private owned lead and galvanized service lines within Census Tracts 3054, 3055, and 3056.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Addresses large health issues by removing services partially constructed of lead pipe.

APPLICANT NAME: GRATZ BOROUGH WATER - LSL REPLACEMENT
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of 225 water service connections (approx. 10,000 feet of plastic service lines) to remove 1927 lead goosenecks and galvanized lines.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: System has had past copper exceedances; lead potential remains from old service lines despite Designation of optimum corrosion control in 2021.

APPLICANT NAME: CITY OF PHILADELPHIA 2025 PART 2
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of approximately 950 residential private lead lines with copper lines, including restoration and customer outreach.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Project increases awareness of lead risks among low-income and sensitive populations while removing lead from the supply.

APPLICANT NAME: PENNSYLVANIA AMERICAN - PITTSBURGH LSLR - PHASE 7
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of 560 lead service lines including the privately-owned portion when encountered.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: System has services partially constructed of lead; removal eliminates health risks from lead poisoning.

APPLICANT NAME: PENNSYLVANIA AMERICAN - NEW CASTLE LSLR - PHASE 3
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of 44 utility/private owned lead and galvanized service lines in Census Tracts 1 and 3.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Elimination of lead poisoning risks by replacing lines partially constructed of lead pipe.

APPLICANT NAME: PENNSYLVANIA AMERICAN - NEW CASTLE LSLR - PHASE 2
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of 112 utility/private owned lead and galvanized water service lines in Census Tracts 1 and 3.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Addresses health risks by removing service lines constructed partially of lead pipe.

APPLICANT NAME: ERIE CITY WATER AUTHORITY - CUSTOMER SIDE GALVANIZED LINE REPLACEMENT - PHASE 6
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Phase 6 removes approximately 1,250 customer-side galvanized lines from curb valve to structure where lead goosenecks were previously present.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Many services have downstream galvanized lines needing replacement to eliminate the chance of lead poisoning.

APPLICANT NAME: ERIE CITY WATER AUTHORITY - CUSTOMER SIDE GALVANIZED LINE REPLACEMENT - PHASE 5
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Phase 5 will replace 1,250 customer-side galvanized services where lead goosenecks historically existed on the public side.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Addresses deteriorated, leaky infrastructure and large health issues caused by lead pipe and galvanized lines.

APPLICANT NAME: ERIE CITY WATER AUTHORITY - CUSTOMER SIDE GALVANIZED LINE REPLACEMENT - PHASE 4
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Phase 4 focuses on removing 1,250 customer-side galvanized service lines at properties with historic public-side lead goosenecks.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Project eliminates lead and the chance of lead poisoning within the service area.

APPLICANT NAME: ERIE CITY WATER AUTHORITY - CUSTOMER SIDE GALVANIZED SERVICE LINE REPLACEMENT - PHASE 3
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Removal and replacement of 860 partial lead service lines where only lead goosenecks were previously removed.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Identified partial lead service lines are a major health issue; replacement eliminates the risk of lead poisoning.

APPLICANT NAME: PENNSYLVANIA AMERICAN - NAZARETH LSLR PHASE 1
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of 130 utility/private owned lead and galvanized impacted service lines in the Borough of Nazareth.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Increases public awareness of lead exposure risks and removes lead to improve situations for vulnerable populations and renters.

APPLICANT NAME: PENNSYLVANIA AMERICAN - PITTSBURGH LSLR - PHASE 8
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of 116 lead service lines, including the privately-owned portion.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Addresses health risks associated with services constructed at least partially of lead pipe.

APPLICANT NAME: PENNSYLVANIA AMERICAN - MILTON LSLR PHASE 1
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of 32 utility/private owned lead and galvanized impacted service lines in the Borough of Milton.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Removes lead from supply and improves conditions for low-income populations and those requiring assistance.

APPLICANT NAME: PENNSYLVANIA AMERICAN - PITTSBURGH LSLR - PHASE 6
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of 324 lead service lines, including the privately-owned portion when encountered.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Elimination of health risks and potential lead poisoning caused by services containing lead pipe.

APPLICANT NAME: PENNSYLVANIA AMERICAN - PITTSBURGH LSLR - PHASE 5
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of a total of 164 lead service lines, including the privately-owned portion.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Removal of lead pipe components in water services to eliminate lead poisoning risks.

APPLICANT NAME: PITTSBURGH WATER AND SEWER AUTHORITY
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Neighborhood LSLR program replacing approx. 580 public and 1,100 private lead service lines across 11 prioritized neighborhoods.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: PWSA has multiple services partially constructed of lead pipe; project aims to eliminate lead and the chance of poisoning within the service area.

APPLICANT NAME: PENNSYLVANIA AMERICAN - MECHANICSBURG LSLR PHASE 1
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of 420 utility/private owned lead and galvanized impacted service lines from house to main.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Addresses health issues caused by lead service lines and aims to eliminate lead throughout the system.

APPLICANT NAME: PENNSYLVANIA AMERICAN - NEW CASTLE LSLR - PHASE 4
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of 82 utility/private owned lead and galvanized service lines in Census Tracts 1 and 3.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Eliminates lead poisoning risk by removing services partially constructed of lead pipe.

APPLICANT NAME: PENNSYLVANIA AMERICAN - NAZARETH LSLR PHASE 2
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of 56 utility/private owned lead and galvanized impacted service lines in the Borough of Nazareth.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Removes lead from supply to improve conditions for vulnerable groups and increase awareness of lead exposure risks.

APPLICANT NAME: PENNSYLVANIA AMERICAN - NEW CASTLE LSLR - PHASE 5
PROJ. DESCRIPTION: Replacement of 492 utility/private owned lead and galvanized impacted service lines in Census Tracts 1 and 3.
PROB. DESCRIPTION: Removes lead pipe components to help eliminate the chance of lead poisoning within the service area.
